Item.text: Verify the node can correctly determine that a next-hop destination is on-link.(link local address)

When sending a packet, a node usesnext-hop determinatio operation to determine the IP address of the appropriate next-hop. Next-hop determination for a given unicast destination operates follows. The sender performs a longest prefix match against the Prefix List to determine whether the packet's destination is on- or off-link. If the destination is on-link, the next-hop address is on-link, the next-hop address is the same as the packet's Destination Address. Otherwise, the sender selects a router from the Default router List. If the Default Router List is empty, the sender assumes that the destination is on-link
